1d93a6f6-55d2-4fb6-85f9-44c6bba2e614.description: Recipients of NAIFA's National Quality Award Winner receive the mark of distinction in one of four practice management areas: life insurance, multiline, financial advising, and/or health and employee benefits. The award is given based on a combination of production levels that supports client retention and client care standards. Financial advisors and insurance agents can qualify in more than one category. Many recipients proudly have won the NQA for decades and reapply each year.
1d93a6f6-55d2-4fb6-85f9-44c6bba2e614.name: NAIFA's National Quality Award Winner

alignments.name: NAIFA's Life Underwriter Training Council Fellow
alignments.description: LUTCF® Designation Program - often considered the first designation any insurance professional should earn - has delivered value to more than 70,000 professionals since 1984. When you earn the LUTCF® designation, you gain critical prospecting, selling, and practice management skills.

alignments.name: NAIFA's Life and Annuities Certified Professional
alignments.description: FINRA-list and fully accredited, NAIFA's Life and Annuities Certified Professional showcases an advisors' knowledge in utilizing life insurance and annuities in financial planning. Advisors holding the LACP are proudly listed in the official LACP database and once the exam is passed, the LACP is a renewable certification every three years.

badge_template_activities.title: Badges are awarded on an annual basis to recognize the previous year's production and client care levels. Four different applications are available for each practice area: life insurance, multiline, financial advising, and health and employee benefits. Individuals have either submitted their application, or a company has deemed a set number of advisors as having met the criteria and submitted on behalf of their advisors.

87fbfe11-54b0-4c3e-93e3-633f6cdd1556.description: Recipients of NAIFA's National Quality Award Winner receive the mark of distinction in one of four practice management areas: life insurance, multiline, financial advising, and/or health and employee benefits. The award is given based on a combination of production levels that supports client retention and client care standards. Financial advisors and insurance agents can qualify in more than one category. Many recipients proudly have won the NQA for decades and reapply each year.
87fbfe11-54b0-4c3e-93e3-633f6cdd1556.name: NAIFA's National Quality Award Winner

alignments.name: NAIFA's Life Underwriter Training Council Fellow
alignments.description: LUTCF® Designation Program - often considered the first designation any insurance professional should earn - has delivered value to more than 70,000 professionals since 1984. When you earn the LUTCF® designation, you gain critical prospecting, selling, and practice management skills.

alignments.name: NAIFA's Life and Annuities Certified Professional
alignments.description: FINRA-list and fully accredited, NAIFA's Life and Annuities Certified Professional showcases an advisors' knowledge in utilizing life insurance and annuities in financial planning. Advisors holding the LACP are proudly listed in the official LACP database and once the exam is passed, the LACP is a renewable certification every three years.

badge_template_activities.title: Badges are awarded on an annual basis to recognize the previous year's production and client care levels. Four different applications are available for each practice area: life insurance, multiline, financial advising, and health and employee benefits. Individuals have either submitted their application, or a company has deemed a set number of advisors as having met the criteria and submitted on behalf of their advisors.

4e4b47e4-3885-44eb-ae59-45a9d9b08303.description: NAIFA offers a three-level course series to train members in grassroots advocacy. Beginning with the basics of meeting with legislators through growing relationships and even running for office, the course prepares NAIFA members to develop relationships with elected and appointed officials to discuss topics and legislation pertinent to their financial services business and that may affect the clients that they serve. Completing the course grants the Financial Security Advocate badge.
4e4b47e4-3885-44eb-ae59-45a9d9b08303.name: Financial Security Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: The NAIFA Grassroots Engagement Course contains three modules (roughly one hour each) to step a NAIFA member through the basics of grassroots advocacy through advanced techniques in developing political relationships. Finishing the 101, 201, and 301 courses allows the individual to achieve the badge of Financial Security Advocate.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

b6762557-e256-45f8-b5f8-d186e287cde3.description: Individuals that hold the LUTCF® (legacy) designation as administered by The American College of Financial Services on behalf of the National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors (NAIFA) satisfied all the educational, ethical, and experience requirements to earn the designation of Life Underwriting Training Council Fellow (LUTCF®). This designation does not expire, and there are no ongoing fees or requirements that must be met to maintain this designation.
b6762557-e256-45f8-b5f8-d186e287cde3.name: The Life Underwriter Training Council Fellow® or LUTCF® Professional Designation

alignments.name: National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors (NAIFA)
alignments.description: The National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors (NAIFA) is the sole owner of the Life Underwriter Training Council Fellow® and LUTCF® trademarks. This badge denotes LUTCF® designees who earned their LUTCF designation prior to July 1, 2015.

badge_template_activities.title: Candidates studied a series of educational manuals and completed multiple courses in order to prepare for end of course examinations. Students passed each of the examinations in order to obtain the designation. LUTCF (legacy) designees have been awarded the right to use the LUTCF designation by the National Association of Insurance and Financial Advisors (NAIFA).
